section.title: When to use
section.p: This procedure can be used in cases where a maintenance activity on an Out-Of-Service (OOS) ME is needed or when an ME needs to be analyzed in isolation (M-OOS state). Site isolation allows operators to manually configure an NCC ME to be in the OOS state. An ME that enters the M-OOS state, does not provide service to the network elements connected to it. Optionally, XDR can also be disabled.

Protocols operating on the following external interfaces are not available to an OOS ME; however, the Monitored services such as LTM, TEM, Policy, and heartbeat reporting to members of the community remain in service.

li.p: An NCC taken out of Service Manually will report an M-OOS Service state to members within the NCC community. This M-OOS State will be reported through the OAM channel. The ME does not receive NAP notifications directly, but they are sent to the Service Manager (SM). In cases where a NAP Notification is destined to the ME that has been declared down, the SM will no longer consider this ME available and will route the message to the secondary. No action is required from the operator.

section.p: To achieve site isolation, the following are performed:

li.p: Manually placing the site in an OOS state.
Verifying that communication through external interfaces has been suppressed.
Verify that the ME site is functioning properly.
